jodd.madvoc.config

Class Target

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.madvoc.config.Target

  • public class Target
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper of a target for IN/OUT operations. It wraps one of these:
    • action object
    • method parameter
    • third-party object
    Target provides a common interface to write or read certain property from a wrapped value.

      • readValue

        public java.lang.Object readValue(InjectionPoint injectionPoint)
        Reads value from the target. If something goes wrong, exception is thrown. We assume that outjection is controlled by developer and that each reading of a value must be a successful operation.

      • readValue

        public java.lang.Object readValue(java.lang.String name)

      • writeValue

        public void writeValue(InjectionPoint injectionPoint,
                       java.lang.Object propertyValue,
                       boolean silent)
        Writes value to this target. Depending on a flag, writing the value can be completely silent, when no exception is thrown and with top performances. Otherwise, an exception is thrown on a failure.

      • writeValue

        public void writeValue(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.Object propertyValue,
                       boolean silent)
